title: Judge Stops Report on Trump's Papers
summary: A judge named Aileen Cannon, who was chosen by former President Trump, has decided to stop a report about how Trump handled secret papers after he left office in 2021. The report was made by special counsel Jack Smith and led to charges against Trump, but the judge dismissed the case in 2024. Two watchdog groups are trying to get the report released by a higher court. In other news, Trump is warning countries to follow trade deals they made, or he might raise taxes on them. The Supreme Court will also hear a case from oil and gas companies trying to stop lawsuits about climate change. This article talks about these three big stories from the news.

background_read: This article is about recent news involving former President Trump and the courts. It explains how a judge stopped a report on Trump's handling of classified documents, which are secret papers important for national security. The report was part of a legal case that got dismissed. Trump is also talking about trade deals with other countries, which are agreements on taxes for goods. The Supreme Court is getting involved in a case about climate change and big companies. These stories show how laws and courts affect politics and the environment.
